ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Throughout this semester, I became a lot more confident and comfortable in my speaking abilities.
I greatly improved in my Italian comprehension and I learned a few things pertaining to the culture as well.
Continued the program from Ital. 130. More of a focus on conversation, though.
I gained a much better understanding of Italian grammar and my confidence in speaking increased greatly.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This was definitely a strong class because there was a great environment that made learning the language enjoyable. I would have liked some more literature but maybe 140 will have more of that.

The class was manageable in terms of pacing and the in class activities were fun and informative. However, by the time the class ended and we began studying for the final, I realized I had forgotten a lot of the things covered in the beginning of the class. I would suggest making the tests and activities more cumulative, to help keep the earlier concepts fresh.
I wish there were less reliance on the textbook and more focus on grammar through reading, as I saw with some of my friends in French L3. Secondly, I wish there was more focus on conversation.
The greatest strength of the course was the welcoming and friendly environment of the classroom, in which did not feel like one was constantly being evaluated for everything one said.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It's a wonderful setting to learn/reinforce italian grammar and still get to watch some movies. What other Yale class can you play Jeopardy in??
I would recommend this class to other students; the pace is manageable and the in class activities are fun and informative.
Yes! Italian is a great department. You will learn a lot. You are probably doing this for the requirements but consider staying on to L4!
Yes, beyond a doubt. The Yale Italian department is fantastic and you won't believe how quickly you make progress.
I would certainly recommend this class for anyone looking to fill a language requirement. It was not too difficult and the only downside is that it meets every day.
